title: AI can now pass the CFA exams: What does that mean for finance jobs?
description: AI models with advanced reasoning have now passed one of the toughest exams for investment professionals. While passing exams and managing day-to-day financial analysis are very different, the latest feat highlights the rapid advancements in AI.

title: Brain-Inspired AI Slashes Energy Use by 99% for Greener Future
description: Researchers are revolutionizing AI by mimicking the human brain's efficiency, developing neuromorphic computing and sparse algorithms to drastically reduce energy consumption—up to 99%—without losing performance. This addresses AI's massive power demands, enabling sustainable applications in edge devices, healthcare, and infrastructure. Innovations promise a greener future for AI.

title: Saro Spadaro: A Visionary Approach to Innovation and AI in the Hospitality Industry
description: For over twenty-five years, Saro Spadaro has been a leading force in the development of hospitality and real estate in the Caribbean. At the helm of The Maho Group, he has played a central role in transforming Sint Maarten into a vibrant ecosystem of luxury resorts, residential developments, and integrated services. His professional path, rooted in experience and shaped by strategic clarity, began shortly after earning a degree in Business Administration from Bocconi University in Milan. Today, his focus is shifting toward a new frontier in the sector: the integration of artificial intelligence. Saro Spadaro views AI not just as a technological advancement but as a strategic opportunity for rethinking how the hospitality industry interacts with its audience. In an environment defined by rising expectations and heightened competition, the ability to deliver personalized, efficient service is no longer optional. Intelligent systems, if properly integrated, can support this evolution—yet failure to adapt may result in diminishing relevance for operators across the sector. For Saro Spadaro, the future of hospitality involves a deep rethinking of digital customer touchpoints. Online experiences need to become more adaptive, intuitive, and compatible with AI interfaces.
